info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Meade and northeastern Pennington Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Creighton, or 36 miles northwest of Philip, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Meade and northeastern Pennington Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for west central South Dakota.
